title: S&P: Prevailing Shorts Above 2988 May Trigger Sell Off
text:
Despite a bullish move on September 9th, 2019, looks to be facing stiff resistance at 2992, due to thick presence of bears; may trigger heavy sell off below 2,988. No doubt that the S&P 500 has attempted one more futile attempt to cross the stiff resistance, 2,992 levels, but exhaustion seems evident enough to result in advent of a steep downward move from the current levels.

Analysis

On analysis of the movements of , in different time frames, I find that despite a bullish move on September 9th, 2019, which resulted in a breakout above Ichimoku cloud in a daily chart; but formation of an “Exhaustive Candle” looks evident enough to trigger heavy sell off which may continue till September 16th, 2019. For watching my upcoming videos, subscribe to my YouTube Channel 'SS Analysis'

Trading Strategies – Short Position Setup

Conservative traders would wait for a new record high to confirm the bearish reversal before committing to a short position.

Moderate traders may wait up to a sustainable move below 2,986 to filter a bear trap.

Aggressive traders may enter now or wait for a pullback up to 2,992 before creating a short position

Trade Sample

→ Entry: 2,992

→ Stop-Loss: 3,030

→ Risk: 38 points

→ Target: 2,878

→ Reward: 114 points

→ Risk : Reward Ratio - 1:3
